page.title: 03Kirkby Industry:Nowadays
page.content: In 1975 Kirkby industrial estate employed 4,000 fewer than its peak of 1959 and by September 1981 the figure had dropped to 14,500 employed in 262 firms. The Merseyside County Council persuaded the government to make it an Industrial Improvement Area and some firms were attracted but the overall pattern has been one of decline. The site was sold to Knowsley Council in May 1982 and now in June 1985 the workforce has dropped to 9000, a third of what it was just over ten years ago and with 144 of the original 380 hectares either derelict or vacant. International and well_known firms which have left the estate include Fisher Bendix, Connolly (Blakeley) subsidiary of BICC, Hygena, Commonwealth Curtain Company and Massey Ferguson.
